reviews.author: John Chekal
comments: Plays an instrumental hands-on technical role on a combination of Network Service Planner (NSP) and Prophecy. In this role, Adam provides a blend of analytical and technical skills to work efficiently and candidly with a demanding customer base. Adam is involved in an array of activities including problem analysis, data analysis, technical design, development, application configuration, deployment, customer consultation, trouble shooting, and normal day-to-day maintenance. He works primarily with JAVA, VB, and Oracle; and his project work involves working in a combination of technical environments.

Adam continues to make significant contributions on both NSP and Prophecy. He's our primary developer on NSP's user interface, traffic sourcing, and reports. His recent NSP accomplishments have been many and include re-working the efficiency and look/feel of user interface, re-working all reports, expanding NSP's analytics, adding several new sandboxes, facilitating model rollout to wider audience of users, and providing support on special studies that allowed the initial Unified Plan analysis to get grounded. On Prophecy, Adam continues to Integrate Incremental enhancements. Recent activity has involved extending the import feature, integrating a new version of vsview, and expanding security on reports. He has also supported our internal requirements related to server migrations, etc, as well as provided day-to-day system maintenance. Adam's contributions have been critical to our success.

Adam Koch is in definite need of a bump to Project Engineer. With expanding work loads in our area, he has recently inherited technical leadership for Prophecy, and his role in NSP is also being expanded to include ownership of several service matrix processes. He continues to play an instrumental role in all our activities surrounding NSP and Prophecy, both on existing support and on new development work, and the breath of his involvement continues to grow. Discussion above describes scope and roll of Adam's position.

Adam is a very solid contributor. He has impressive educational credentials, possesses a strong technical aptitude, has good long term potential, and he consistently gets the job done. His genuine interest in adding value combined with his technical skill set clearly position him to provide a strong fit both now and in the future, and it's important we provide appropriate career development for him. It's been over three years since his last promotion, and considering his length of stay, level of contribution, and additional responsibilities; a promotion within band is in order.

responsibilities.description: NSP - To work on the Network Schedule Planner (NSP) system by enhancing, fixing and maintaining the application as required. This includes hands-on programming of the Weblogic environment and the Unix NSP server
tasks: Work on the fixes/enhancements listed in the NSP Discussion Database
Enhance Car Scheduling engine to allow the scheduling of multiple scenarios
Complete the graphical display (GIS) of car routes by the end of July
Build a web service capable of handling a large (but undetermined) number of requests by the end of 2006
Create standard process for "special studies"
Generate train statistics from scenario (if decided to implement)
Integrate equipment handling rules (if decided to implement)
Tune application for quicker responses, specifically page displays and reports
Take over Service Matrix (SM) responsibilities from Mark Mordeson
Process automation: Automate loads of database and lookup-ups. Automate mainenance on ?? files
Update NSP as required for any Infrastructure initiatives
Keep all areas of deployment (development, test, and production) up-to-date and running
Monitor the production environment for potential problems
Provide time and services for any group that wishes to do a "special study"
Support the customers with any issues or enhancements
Provide information or support to other groups
Enhance the application(s) per user requests, including ability to manually set the vintage id for the "Revision" vintage when rebuilding the summary table
Coordinate efforts to deploy new versions of Prophecy to the users
Migrate away from 3rd party controls to more standard Microsoft controls
Enhance import feature to display more user feedback
Help with the deployment of SAS and with the integation of SAS with Prophecy
[More to do]
